website_summaries.verdict: Highly adored for its superior waterproofness and tough rubber outsole, the Columbia Crestwood Waterproof hiking shoe is one of a kind. It’s a top choice by many casual hikers and backpackers because it’s lightweight, sturdy, and has great traction. On top of these features is a budget-friendly price tag. It’s a great shoe overall, although its toe box might feel a bit narrow for some.
pros: The majority of reviewers have given the Columbia Crestwood Waterproof excellent ratings for keeping their feet warm and dry, even on snowdrifts
Wearers are stunned by how the shoe demonstrates amazing comfort without being bulky
Dozens of hikers attest to the durability of the Columbia Crestwood Waterproof
Some have had the same pair of shoes for years now
A lot of those who have purchased this waterproof hiking shoe say it fits their foot nicely
Many hikers applaud the Columbia Crestwood Waterproof for having great traction
The non-marking rubber outsole allows them to navigate different types of terrain
Customers love that the shoe is lightweight but still provides good arch support
Considering its features, many agree that the Columbia Crestwood is a budget-friendly hiker
cons: Some customers wish the toe box is a little roomier
A few customers note that these hiking shoes from Columbia need a better insole

customer_reviews.title: Great traction. Kept my feet dry.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Took these shoes on many more trips in both cold and wet Europe and the balmy and muddy Caribbeans. Still holding up very well. The stitches are in good shape. Traction still appear in very good condition. Original review: Great traction. Was able to hike on most surface without an issue. Kept my feet dry in the wet Scotland and Ireland. Seems to be holding up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: ... walking in the rain and the size fits fairly comfortably. However
customer_reviews.text: My feet stay dry when walking in the rain and the size fits fairly comfortably. However, the cushioning is fairly minimal, so if you have chronically sore feet you may wish to consider inserts. The back of the shoe has also been rubbing the skin right off my achilles heel (it was causing enough damage that someone I was walking with noticed the blood on my socks.) I've taken to wearing a bandaid on the back of each foot where this happens, at least until the shoes break in a bit. It's worth noting that this might only be a problem if you wear low cut socks or own socks that have worn thin.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Obetz

customer_reviews.title: Order size up, get a great deal
customer_reviews.text: So for these, the factory has lined up Europe and USA sizes wrong. These are true to Europe sizes and way too small for the USA sizes on the box. I ordered USA 16 and on the box is US 16, EU 49 which is more like a US15, what I wear, and they fit perfectly. Order at least one US size up and you are golden for a great 75% off deal.
customer_reviews.author: E Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Breaking in? No problem
customer_reviews.text: No breaking in necessary. I took it on a snowtrail in a state park for 4 hours with snow falling all around me, roots and slippery ice and no issues. If you do plan to stay outside over night though, then it probably does not have enough insulation for that. But for a day hike, great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Lerone

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, not the best traction especially on we rock
customer_reviews.text: Decent tracking through the woods damp or dry. Decent on rock dry. When wet its a whole different thing. Slipped several times in wet conditions especially on rock. They feel narrow and tall compared to my Merrill shoes I had before these. The treads round along the edges giving less traction surface and they hold mud
customer_reviews.author: K10BigMudder

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking/walking boots I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 15 shoe, so is very hard to find a shoe that fits and is comfortable. These are fantastic at any price, but at $33 were a complete steal. They are waterproof also, which is a huge plus. Fantastic buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon LuvER

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Runs small but overall good quality. My husband has a size 16 foot so it was nice to find something for a good price. He put the shoe on and took a hair dryer to to help stretch it out and break them in.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Could use a little more padding to insoles and make sure you order a bigger size
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair similar to these and they lasted a long time,but were a little small. Ordered this pair a full size bigger. These are my everyday shoes around the house and in the yard, hope they last as long as my old ones
customer_reviews.author: Chinkjr2

customer_reviews.title: Overall okay shoes
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad overall. Just need to break them in more. I wish I had got a size smaller for the length, but other than that, I think they are fine.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Good durable shoe
customer_reviews.text: Just right for the price especially for a size 15 which is hard to find. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for 6’6” son in law. He loves them
customer_reviews.author: Fran Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I have big feet, size 15, so I'm used to problems with fit. These were good right out of the box. Comfortable, lightweight and water resistant - exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, although not to size.
customer_reviews.text: Surprised to find I needed to step these up 1/2 size. Don’t recall ever having that need.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes, in fact I don't just wear them on the trail. They look great and are put together very well.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Barrow

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe choice
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit perfectly and were perfect for camping in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Steven McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Only buy columbia boots for winter
customer_reviews.text: Awesome support awesome traction very easy to walk in a must buy stay safe stay warm
customer_reviews.author: Arvet h. Butcher

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, true to size
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Good support, hiked 40 miles over 4 days. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: cdale

customer_reviews.title: Good summer hiking sneakers in mountains
customer_reviews.text: Sneakers are very pleased. They are comfortable and sturdy, well support and protect the foot. I walked in them a lot in the mountains and felt great. The sole very well clings to wet stones and soil and does not slip. I even had to wade a shallow stream, and my legs were dry.
customer_reviews.author: Charina

customer_reviews.title: they must have changed their cut
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these shoes in the past and the cut on the toe has changed. even after wearing for two weeks they still feel small.
customer_reviews.author: T.Parsons

customer_reviews.title: When I choose Columbia I was expecting quality and I'm disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Only 3 months of moderate use in a dusty environment!I bought it on 25 September.... actually less than 3 months! You can see in pictures! If you intend to do light trekking you should be satisfied ! Comfortable but not reliable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of outdoor shoe
customer_reviews.text: Had an flaw with first pair I ordered but exchanged with no issue. Exactly what he wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Maryssa Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not water proof
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not water proof. I work in the sprinkler business and my feet get soaked within minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Lueck

customer_reviews.title: It's water proof, comfortable, and durable.
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing hiking shoe! I went on a two week hiking trip deep in Alaska and it held up nicely. Its light weight but high quality. You're going to love this shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They run about 1/2 size small. Ordered 1/2 larger than my normal size and they were perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Got them for kicking around the yard in cooler weather. They are comfortable and keep my feet warm on cooler days. If I keep them on inside, feet get a little toasty. They are exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D Cayce

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Traction
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, great traction in the snow and slippery surfaces and very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: George A. Howanitz

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my boyfriend and he loves them. Comfy, sturdy, and fit great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. Comfortable to work and walk 5-8 miles daily
customer_reviews.author: Amy Medley

customer_reviews.title: VERY SMALL!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn 11.5 for 25 years and worn Columbia for at least 10 in size 11.5. They have always fit fine. This is the 2nd pair of Columbia in a row from Amazon that have been VERY SMALL. I first got an 11.5 and it was small. Sent back and got these in a 12. They were even smaller. I would consider them about 10 to 10.5. They may be fine shoes once I find the (new) proper size. I'll give it a 3 for now and update on the next pair I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Krisasand

product_meta.title: Columbia Men's Crestwood Waterproof Hiking Shoe
product_meta.description: A lightweight and durable shoe designed for multiple activities on the trail.
feature_bullets: Combination upper featuring leather, mesh and webbing
International products have separate terms, are sold from abroad and may differ from local products, including fit, age ratings, and language of product, labeling or instructions.
